page.title: 03THE BLAISDON PLUM
page.content: {A plum worth talking about. Mr and Mrs Walton, Tanhouse Farm Blaisdon grow the Blaisdon plum. Mr Walton's family were fruit merchants in Liverpool until his father settled in Blaisdon to supply the business. At one time Blaisdons were their sole crop,now they keep cattle and sheep too for the jam market is in decline. The{Blaisdon}is a commercial plum, first grown in the village 120 years ago by a Mr Dowding. It will only grow within a 25 mile radius of the village. It is smaller than a{Victoria {but travels}better although it is quite acidic. The trees are self pollinating, reach maturity in about 12 years and produce good yields for the next 30.They need some spraying but unlike Victorias don't suffer from silver blight.
